title: Thunderbird continually crashing and hanging up my computer
content:
When using Thunderbird, the program continually crashes and hangs up my computer.

I frequently use the task manger to try to stop the crash, but this only helps about 30% of the time. Usually I have to reboot.

I have a Surface Pro 8 with Windows 11. I have version 128.2.3esr (64-bit) installed, but this problem has continued through several versions.

This problem happens frequently when I click on the icons to write an e-mail, reply to an e-mail, or if I search for an e-mail. These are the three functions that cause this (as far as I know).

I removed all add-ons.

I cleared the cache.

I tried running Thunderbird in Trouble Shooting mode.

None of these things resolved the problem.

I would appreciate help/advice with this.

Sincerely,

David
creator: tindall1

title: Email on new google email account
content:

I need to get Thunderbird on my new email. I have already paid for additional security under my old email address. How do I get thunderbird for my new email and transfer the additional security to it? I have been searching google on how to accomplish this and it is as clear as mud. I am not technically savvy, therefore need human support. I do not have a record of a password for my account. Please call or email me with information in laymanâ€™s terms of how to make the transfer to my gmail. My phone number is [edited phone# from public community support forum].

title: Importing thunderbird profiles fom another computer without overwriting existing
content: Many thanks if you can help.
creator: lindoig

title: Oude bestaande gegevens niet meer bereikbaar
content:
Beste mensen, Als gevolg van een probleem heb ik Thunderbirds opnieuw geinstalleerd. Dezelfde versie. De verwijzing naar alle bestaande data lukt mij maar steeds niet. Mijn accounts, adresboek, agenda, locala mappen enz. staat in een bestaande map D:\MAIL-Thunderbird. Hierin staat ook de submap Instellingen. Waar en wat moet ik dan aanpassen om deze map te laten gebruiken? Er staan in de .ini fiels waarschijnlijk ook dingen die weg kunnen/moeten.

In profiles.ini staat:

[InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/3oyoh3m8.default-release Locked=1

[Profile1] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/3oyoh3m8.default-release Default=1

[Profile0] Name=Ben IsRelative=0 Path=D:\MAIL-Thunderbird\Instellingen Default=1

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

In install.ini staat:

[D78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/3oyoh3m8.default-release Locked=1

In de map Profiles (op de C drive) staat:

3oyoh3m8.default-release
creator: b.huijsdens

title: Authentification
content: Thanks to the unnecessary and pointless meddling of Microsoft I am not unable to send or receive e-mails via Thunderbird. I constantly receive "log in failure message". When asked to re-enter the appropriate password I enter the never ending merry-go-round......I have 6 addresses. Whilst it is possible to access then via their specific accounts held with Microsoft this is time consuming,hence the preference of Thunderbirdb which up until now has been trouble free for approx 15 years. This unnecessary development makes me wonder why I only need a user naame aand password to access via Microsoft. I have tried every method kindly provided by other users to no avail. Can anyone provide the correct server setting for both IMAP and SMTP? As I have said these 'new' authentification/s are in my opinion tantamount to using a sledgehammer to crack a walnut. I hope my explantion makes sense? Surely I cannot be alone?
creator: under.pressure

title: Email tabs blank after restart (Win & Lin)
content:
Win 10 - latest version Linux Mint Cinnamon - latest version

After each restart of Thunderbird, many email tabs appear with empty blank content. Imagine having many open tabs with emails and having to manually search for these emails and reopen them and close the blank email Tabs after every restart to see the content. It's simply hilarious.

And I've had this problem for a year now. Even after a complete reinstallation of e.g. Linux Mint. I have already switched to a Thunderbird fork on Windows, which does not have these problems.
creator: Nikki_Blanco

title: No warning when a server is down?
content:
I am testing a private POP3 mail server, so I set up an account in Thunderbird for it. I set it to check for email every minute.

I have since shut the server down, but Thunderbird is giving me no warning that it is unable to fetch new messages for the account, which I find surprising.

What is the expected behaviour?

title: Linked Hotmail Account - Preview Pane Display
content: Occasionally, when using Thunderbird to check my linked Hotmail account messages the preview pane displays the the following; ----boundary_75e27897dff0419baf014a41bcb9dc32-- This happens on all messages that have downloaded since my last login to Thunderbird. All other accounts behave as usual and show the contents of the messages. I can open Hotmail and view the messages without issue. Once I have opened Hotmail and then return to the Thunderbird account everything functions properly, but the previous messages with the error remain unchanged when selecting to preview the contents. Anyone have any knowledge about this as an issue or a solution?

title: Unable to Sync Zoho Contacts
content:
Hi,

When I add my Zoho account, which is using a personal domainname, to Thunderbird the addressbook is discovered and added, but none of the contacts are synced.

If I add a contact in Thunderbird to the Zoho addressbook, the contact appears in Zoho's webmail contacts page, but is not counted in the number of contacts. When I edit the same contact in Zoho's webmail contacts page, the contact disappears from Thunderbird.

the URI I am using is https://contacts.zoho.com/carddav/my_email/default/contacts/

Where my_email is my account email address.

I'm using an account specific password, IMAP, SMTP and CalDAV work (though not calendar discovery - I have to add each calendar individually) and my DNS records have SRV records for all the services on Zoho.

I'm running Thunderbird 128.2.3esr Flatpak from flathub on OpenSUSE Tumbleweed.

Any ideas why this isn't working - I've seen a number of people having success with Zoho and Thunderbird.

Thanks

Alan
creator: am4c130d
